description: A general vulnerability was identified in the TendaTelnet function involving insufficiently validated system command execution. The function first forcibly terminates the telnet service using `system("killall -9 telnetd")`, then restarts the service by executing "telnetd -b %s &" via `doSystemCmd`. The %s parameter is derived from a configuration value obtained through `GetValue`. If this configuration can be externally controlled (e.g., via a web interface), it poses a command injection risk. Attackers could potentially gain complete device control by injecting malicious commands.
code_snippet:
mov r0, r3                  ; "killall -9 telnetd"
bl sym.imp.system
...
mov r0, r2                  ; "telnetd -b %s &"
mov r1, r3
bl sym.imp.doSystemCmd

description: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability detected. The function uses `sprintf` to construct a string (0x4f9d4) without explicitly checking the destination buffer size. If an attacker can control the format string parameter, it may lead to stack overflow and result in arbitrary code execution.
code_snippet:
mov r0, r2
mov r1, r3
mov r2, 0xe
mov r3, 0x18
bl sym.imp.sprintf
